product_name: MuradSuperactive Brightening Moisturizer SPF 50 with Vitamin C
summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeHSA/FSA eligibleMurad's Brightening Moisturizer SPF 50 with Vitamin C targets dull and damaged skin with super potent vitamin C, plus instant hydration and SPF 50 protection
details: DetailsBenefitsSupercharged 3-in-1 moisturizer hydrates all day as it protects skin with high-level broad spectrum SPF 50, with no white castBrightens skin in just one use with powerful, long-lasting vitamin CHelps fade and prevent dark spotsNon-comedogenic, lightweight and fast-absorbingLayers well under makeupKey Ingredients10x more potent vitamin C*: minimizes visible signs of UV damage, including dull and uneven skinLipid-boosting tech: helps replenish ceramides to restore moistureUltra-sheer SPF 50: helps prevent premature aging from UVA/UVB damage*vs previous formulaResearch ResultsSkin looks brighter after 1 use*Skin appears more even-toned in 1 week*Helps visibly fade all types of dark spots in 4 weeks* (including age spots, sun spots, post-acne dark spots, and hyperpigmentation)*4-week consumer perception study on 33 participants, Fitzpatrick I-VIItem 2635515How To UseTo Use: AM: Apply liberally over face, neck, and chest.For external use only. Avoid contact with eyes. Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.IngredientsActive: Avobenzone 3.0%, Homosalate 7.0%, Octisalate 5.0%, Octocrylene 5.0%. Inactive: Water (Aqua), Propanediol, Cocoglycerides, 3-O-Ethyl Ascorbic Acid, Butyloctyl Salicylate, Glyceryl Stearate, Palmitic Acid, Cetearyl Alcohol, Cetearyl Glucoside, Stearic Acid, Cetyl Phosphate, Urea, Yeast Amino Acids, Trehalose, Inositol, Taurine, Betaine, Panthenol, Sodium PCA, Tocopheryl Acetate, Persea Gratissima (Avocado) Oil, Hydrogenated Vegetable Oil, Tocopherol, Xanthan Gum, Magnesium Aluminum Silicate, Cellulose, Ethylhexylglycerin, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Cellulose Gum, Caprylhydroxamic Acid, Tetrasodium Glutamate Diacetate, Aminomethyl Propanol, Sodium Citrate, Citric Acid, Arachidic Acid, Titanium Dioxide, Myristic Acid, Lauric Acid, Leuconostoc/Radish Root Ferment Filtrate, Chlorphenesin, Sodium Benzoate, Limonene, Citrus Aurantium Peel Oil, Fragrance (Parfum), Iron Oxides (CI 77492).Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: To Use: AM: Apply liberally over face, neck, and chest.For external use only. Avoid contact with eyes. Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away.

reviews.headline: Got less skin damage from the sun
reviews.comments: Loved the old formula . Now my face has giant rashes all over it within the first day of use

reviews.headline: Gentle
reviews.comments: I received this product in exchange for my honest review. This product is a three in one with Vitamin C as well as 50+ SPF working as a moisturizer as well! It is very convenient with the pump ensuring that the perfect amount of product is used liberally across the face, neck, and chest. The smell of it is not too much either. Great for sensitive skin as well.

reviews.headline: Too thick
reviews.comments: I use Murad daily with SPF 30. Decided to try this with SPF 50 but it's thick & caused me to break out. Bummer

reviews.headline: Brightening effect
reviews.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I've been using the Murad Superactive Moisturizer SPF 50 for a few weeks now, and it's quickly become a staple in my morning routine. The texture is lightweight yet deeply hydrating, which makes it perfect for layering under makeup or wearing on its own for a fresh, dewy finish.

What stands out most is its brightening effect‚Äîwithin days, my skin tone looked more even, and some of the dullness I usually notice in the morning was noticeably improved. It gives a subtle glow without looking greasy. The SPF 50 is a major plus, offering solid protection without the heavy, chalky feel that many high-SPF products leave behind.

My only small issue is that, while it's labeled "superactive," it may not be rich enough for very dry skin types on its own. But for normal to combination skin, it's a win. Bonus points for no white cast and no breakouts.

reviews.headline: 10/10 !! Would get again
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] Love the easy pump this has! It's super smooth and I love the way it applies. Does have a light smell compared to others! Works great and blends in well!

reviews.headline: HORRIBLE!
reviews.comments: The new formula breaks my face out! I have used the prior formula for years and I am so disappointed with this change. I never had any issues with the prior formula and this one keeps breaking my face out. Very, very disappointed.

reviews.headline: Highly recommend!
reviews.comments:
Schools out and so is the sun! Protecting your skin is the best action you can take to avoid wrinkles and sun spots.  I am no stranger to the Murad skin care brand, and have used their 30 SPF moisturizer before. But this is their new 50 SPF Brightening formula with stabilized vitamin C (this just means the ascorbic acid won't degrade or oxidize as easily, keeping your product safe and effectiveü§ù) First of all it gives a beautiful glow to wear on it's own, but dries down enough to be a good base for foundation.
 I've been wearing it every day during pickleball, and although I'm a sweaty mess, it hasn't dripped into my eyes at all. We all know how terrible sunscreen burns your eyes!!  It's very smoothing, has a great texture and light citrus scent.  I honestly have no notes! 5/5 would recommend üëç
(I got this for free from @influenster in exchange for my honest opinion)

reviews.headline: I have used it daily!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This is absolutely perfect! Lotion and sunscreen all in one plus vitamin c is an added bonus. I love the bottle and dispenser too. I have used it daily and ai highly recommend!

reviews.headline: hydrating SPF!!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] this smooth moisturizer is nice to use on the skin before applying makeup. i love the pump for getting product out and the amount you get with each pump! it has a light citrus scent. SPF is essential in my skincare/makeup routine so i'm happy to add this. super moisturizing ‚Äî probably best for winter if you have oily skin in the summer like i do.

reviews.headline: It truly lives up to the 3-in-1 promise!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] The Murad Superactive Moisturizer SPF 50 has quickly become a new favorite in my routine. It truly lives up to the 3-in-1 promise hydrating, brightening, and protecting all in one step. The texture is lightweight and absorbs fast, leaving my skin with a beautiful, healthy glow (no white cast!). I love that it's packed with 10x more potent vitamin C, it really helps even out my skin tone and makes my complexion look fresher after just one use. Plus, it wears perfectly under makeup.

reviews.headline: SPF
reviews.comments: I received this product in exchange for my honest review.  I tried this moisturizer with sunscreen from Murad and I didn't love it, since I have combination skin and it feels a bit oily when I apply it. It has a slight citrus scent, but it leaves my skin with some glowing due to the vitamin C content. It doesn't leave a white cast, and I liked the packaging.

reviews.headline: 10/10 Sunscreen
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This is sunscreen is one of the best out there especially as a darker skin tone person. It leaves no white cast and has a clean scent which is perfect. It feels light on the face and leaves you moisturized all day!

reviews.headline: Love it, must for busy moms
reviews.comments: It feels lightweight and absorbs well without leaving a greasy finish. My skin looks more hydrated and glowy. Plus I like that it is SPF 50 and vitamin C which provides more protection and brightness to skin than many moisturizers.

reviews.headline: Love it!
reviews.comments: Murad is my favorite brand. I am trying the Superactive Moisturizer with SPF 50 and I am falling in love with it. It moisturizes, hydrates, and protects my skin.

reviews.headline: Brightening sun protection
reviews.comments: I received this product for free in exchange for my review. This moisturizer is a great all-in-one for anyone wanting hydration, sun protection, and a brighter complexion. It's lightweight, absorbs quickly, and doesn't leave a white cast, which is a huge win if you have deeper/darker skin. The SPF 50 is strong enough for daily use, and it sits well under makeup without pilling. It contains skin brightening ingredients, vitamin C. It does have a light fragrance, so keep that in mind if you have sensitive skin. Can't forget that it is available with HSA!!

reviews.headline: Not my favorite
reviews.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] It's decent but not a favorite. 
It didn't leave a white cast on me; however, I am extremely fair skin. It does have a smoother finish that leaves behind a bit of a glow which I attribute to the vitamin c doing what it claims to. I was not very impressed with how long it seemed to take to absorb into my skin without leaving more of an oily feel that sat on top of my skin.

reviews.headline: Brightening and Protecting
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This sunscreen doesn't leave a white cast and it's very lightweight. It has brightening effects while protecting me from the sun, which is ideal for summer. It also doesn't have a heavy sunscreen scent and it doesn't burn my eyes like other sunscreens after a few hours of use.

reviews.headline: Love this spf
reviews.comments: I've been loving the Environmental Shield‚Ñ¢ Superactive Moisturizer SPF 50! It's a true multitasker‚Äîlightweight, non-greasy, and gives my skin a beautiful glow. The stabilized vitamin C instantly brightens, and over time I've noticed a visible improvement in dark spots. I also appreciate the broad spectrum SPF 50 / PA++++ protection without any white cast. It layers perfectly under makeup and keeps my skin hydrated all day. A new skincare favorite!

reviews.headline: Skincare + SPF!
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] It's awesome to find an American-made SPF that works as well as those I've tried from South Korea! Absolutely no white cast, added vitamin C, broad spectrum SPF 50, AND packaging made from recycled materials! There's also a light scent that transports me to sunny Summer days on the beach. What's not to love?

reviews.headline: Great for everyday use
reviews.comments: [I received this product in exchange for my honest review] This is such a great SPF for everyday use. Thick and creamy but spreads easily on the skin. It's worth the money because it's super efficient. The scent is light like citrus thanks to the vitamin c. Not only did it protect my skin it brightened my dark spots and left my skin moisturized. I highly recommend it as an affordable everyday facial SPF.

media.headline: Earned a Spot on my Bathroom Counter!
Earned a Spot on my Bathroom Counter!

faceoff_positive.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] 
I've been using Murad's Superactive Moisturizer SPF 50 with Vitamin C for a little over two weeks now, and I'm honestly loving it. My skin usually gets along really well with vitamin C, and this product was no exception‚Äîit absorbed beautifully with no irritation or weird reactions.

The pump makes it super easy to apply (no mess or squeezing tubes), and the texture is just right‚Äînot too thick or greasy. It spreads evenly, feels light on the skin, and best of all‚Äîno white cast! It's not sticky at all and has this subtle, fresh scent that's not overpowering.

What's great is that it's more than just a sunscreen. It's like a multitasking moisturizer with SPF 50 that hydrates all day, brightens your complexion, and even helps fade dark spots over time. I've actually noticed my skin looking more even and radiant lately, which is a big plus.

It's also non-comedogenic and layers well under makeup‚Äîhuge win for busy mornings. The formula is packed with 10x more potent vitamin C (compared to Murad's previous formula), which helps tackle visible signs of UV damage like dullness and uneven tone. Plus, it's got lipid-boosting tech to replenish moisture and restore your skin barrier.

All in all, if you're looking for a lightweight, everyday SPF that also gives you that vitamin C glow, I'd definitely recommend giving this one a try!
faceoff_positive.headline: Love this!

faceoff_negative.comments:
[I received this product in exchange for my honest review] I recently tried the Murad Superactive Moisturizer with SPF 50, and while it has some really nice qualities, my experience ended up being a bit of a mixed bag.

First off, the product applies smoothly and feels rich on the skin, though it's a little thicker than some sunscreens I've used. It wears well under makeup and I didn't experience any pilling, which is always a plus. Overall, it's comfortable to wear and doesn't interfere with my makeup routine.

However, I decided to run a little experiment to test its sun protection. I applied a generous amount of the Murad sunscreen to one hand and my usual sunscreen to the other, then went outside with UV detection stickers on both hands. Unfortunately, I was really disappointed by the results. Despite layering a second coat of the Murad sunscreen, it didn't seem to provide sufficient protection‚Äîthe UV exposure on both hands was pretty much the same.

In the end, while the Murad Superactive Moisturizer SPF 50 feels great on the skin and works well under makeup, its actual sun protection doesn't seem to measure up based on my experiment. For anyone looking for reliable sun defense, I'd recommend considering other options.
faceoff_negative.headline: Mixed review
